channel.title: TIME Magazine Online: Top Stories
channel.description: TIME's top stories of the day
channel.copyright: Copyright @ 2006 Time Inc. All rights reserved.
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site, subject to copyright and fair use.

item.title: Did Nancy Pelosi Get The Message?
item.description: She followed up her victory with a self-defeating blunder. Now people are asking, Is Pelosi up to the job?

item.title: Escaping Washington, But Not Escaping Iraq
item.description: Touring Vietnam, a chastened Bush finds parallels to the present hard to avoid

item.title: The Passion of the Pope
item.description: With his blunt talk on Islam, Benedict XVI is altering the debate between the Muslim world and the West. On the eve of his visit to Turkey, TIME looks at the roots of the Pope's views-and how they may define his place in history

item.title: Iraqi Arrest Warrant Revives a Sunni Cleric's Fortunes
item.description: Analysis: Harith al-Dari was in danger of drifting into obscurity until the Iraqi government ordered his arrest. Now he could emerge as the leader of Iraq's Sunnis

item.title: 5 Myths About the Midterm Elections
item.description: Did the bloggers matter in the end? Are the Dems more conservative? Did Republicans lose on the war? TIME separates fact from fiction

item.title: A Real Dog Fight in Beijing
item.description: As a city moves to curb its canine population, typically timid middle-class citizens find themselves fighting the power
